Class King

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.King
public class King extends Piece
Represents a king chess piece. The king can move one square in any direction, and it can also perform castling under certain conditions.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    boolean
    isFirstMove
    Indicates if the king has moved for the first time, relevant for castling.
    final int
    value
    The value of a king piece, typically used for material evaluation in chess.

  • Constructor Details

    • King

      public King(Game.Color color)
      Constructs a King with a specified color.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • castleKingSide

      public boolean castleKingSide(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Checks if castling on the king-side is possible for the king. The conditions for castling include: the king has not moved, the rook has not moved, the path between the king and the rook are clear, and the king is not in check.
      Parameters:
      start - The starting square of the move.
      end - The ending square of the move.
      game - The current game instance.
      Returns:
      True if the king can castle on the king-side, false otherwise.

    • makeCastleKingSide

      public void makeCastleKingSide(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Performs castling on the king-side by moving the king and the rook to their new positions.
      Parameters:
      start - The starting square of the move.
      end - The ending square of the move.
      game - The current game instance.

    • castleQueenSide

      public boolean castleQueenSide(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Checks if castling on the queen-side is possible for the king. The conditions for castling include: the king has not moved, the rook has not moved, the path between the king and the rook are clear, and the king is not in check.
      Parameters:
      start - The starting square of the move.
      end - The ending square of the move.
      game - The current game instance.
      Returns:
      True if the king can castle on the queen-side, false otherwise.

    • allowedMove

      public boolean allowedMove(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Determines if the King is allowed to move from the starting square to the ending square. The King can move one square in any direction, or castling can occur if conditions are met.
      Specified by:
      allowedMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      start - The square where the King is currently located.
      end - The square the King is trying to move to.
      game - The current game object, which contains the state of the game.
      Returns:
      true if the move is allowed, false otherwise.

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Executes the King's move from the starting square to the ending square. If the move involves castling, the appropriate castling move is made.
      Overrides:
      makeMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      start - The square where the King is currently located.
      end - The square the King is moving to.
      game - The current game object, which contains the state of the game.

    • allowedCapture

      public boolean allowedCapture(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Determines if the King is allowed to capture a piece from the starting square to the ending square. The King can capture a piece in any direction, as long as it is one square away.
      Specified by:
      allowedCapture in class Piece
      Parameters:
      start - The square where the King is currently located.
      end - The square the King is trying to capture a piece from.
      game - The current game object, which contains the state of the game.
      Returns:
      true if the capture is allowed, false otherwise.

    • makeCapture

      public void makeCapture(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Executes the King's capture from the starting square to the ending square. After the capture, the King's first move state is updated.
      Overrides:
      makeCapture in class Piece
      Parameters:
      start - The square where the King is currently located.
      end - The square the King is capturing a piece from.
      game - The current game object, which contains the state of the game.

    • copy

      public Piece copy()
      Creates a new copy of the King, including its first move state.
      Specified by:
      copy in class Piece
      Returns:
      A new copy of the King piece.
